sn35.129:4.1: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
sn35.129:4.2: Then the householder Ghosita went up to Venerable Ānanda,
sn35.129:4.4: “Sir, Ānanda, they speak of ‘the diversity of elements’.
sn35.129:4.5: In what way did the Buddha speak of the diversity of elements?”
sn35.129:4.6: “Householder, the eye element is found, as are agreeable sights, and eye consciousness.
sn35.129:4.7: Pleasant feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.
sn35.129:4.8: The eye element is found, as are disagreeable sights, and eye consciousness.
sn35.129:4.9: Painful feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as painful.
sn35.129:4.10: The eye element is found, as are sights that are a basis for equanimity, and eye consciousness.
sn35.129:4.11: Neutral feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as neutral.
sn35.129:4.18: mind element is found, as are agreeable phenomena, and mind consciousness.
sn35.129:4.19: Pleasant feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.
sn35.129:4.20: The mind element is found, as are disagreeable phenomena, and mind consciousness.
sn35.129:4.21: Painful feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as painful.
sn35.129:4.22: The mind element is found, as are phenomena that are a basis for equanimity, and mind consciousness.
sn35.129:4.23: Neutral feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as neutral.
sn35.129:4.24: This is how the Buddha spoke of the diversity of elements.”
